documents.document: So I had a weird dream that I was cross-examining B*mber Br*dbury in Court last night. It was a bizarre, yet richly satisfying, experience.
Um, what? I think @grantelliottnz would disagree. #hairyjavelin https://t.co/jb4MYgdaNZ
@JayHarvie But anyway, happy to continue this debate over a brew produced by any one of these three, delicious, sell-outs.
@JayHarvie They did exist before they sold shares to Lion. They aren't a BRB or a Black Dog.
@JayHarvie Emerson's not a craft brewer? Um, what: https://t.co/A6Iu0AsQxw
@JayHarvie and I would also argue that Tuatara did enough of this just to make ends meet before signing. Hopefully less after.
@JayHarvie I think the Emerson's example clearly disproves this. Their range expanded after signing the Lion deal.
@JayHarvie which is exactly what this deal is going to give them more time to do. As opposed to having to focus on funds and logistics.
Didn't the @TheACCnz first suggest this whilst calling the "tackle" yesterday? https://t.co/1VV1M6ptud
Re the predictable reaction to the Tuatara share sale, I refer to @BeerhiveBlog's neat article on the Panhead deal https://t.co/IiBjHULO1b
@JayHarvie maybe I'll just refer to this: https://t.co/IiBjHULO1b
@JayHarvie You mean "Not sure how I feel about this trend of small local craft breweries making any money for their hard work".
@steelematt22 @TuataraBrew if anything, it should improve it.
The damage to his manhood from the crash tackle onto concrete was, apparently, punishment enough. https://t.co/PoeijJmaX8
@al_nz this isn't what happened with either of Emersons or Panhead. I'm confident Tuatara will also manage to keep their own distinct brand.
Tuatara goes the same way of Emersons and Panhead. Very interesting. https://t.co/fZKkyjTHz0
Of all the Trump nicknames I've heard, "Darth Orange" has to be one of the best.
@GraemeEdgeler I think we are too. Did the Judge give any guidance as to what would be sufficient?
@GraemeEdgeler Not true. They called evidence as to the element, it just wasn't sufficient to meet the threshold.
Messages like this make my eyes bleed. https://t.co/MTODWS1Mgk
A day at the office Jimmy Neesham would like to forget in a hurry. #NZvsAUS
Stoinis has to be Man of the Match. What a game. #NZvAUS
IT'S A FREAKER! #NZvAUS
Seeing more than a bit of Rockin' Rod Latham in Munro's bowling action. #NZvAUS
@Yakcall what kind of "stuff"?
What on earth is happening at the bottom of Willis Street?
@Sportsfreakconz how many of those scores since the redesign? Still, this is one of my tweets I want to look back on later and laugh at.
Put simply, not enough. #NZvAUS
"Even though I didn't see the event in question and you did, you're still wrong". Most sports arguments people have on Facebook.
@DanRockNZ and the reason you don't go now is entirely because "they killed it" and not maybe you wanted to do something different?
All these 7s hot takes and no one seems to acknowledge that maybe it died because not everyone wants to go to the same party for 15 years.
@IamNotJonahHill when it comes to the Black Caps, I'm never confident. Quietly or otherwise.
And so the annual anxious thoughts of "please don't get thumped" begin... #NZvAUS
That game was a piece of art from Federer.
I'm a BOP lad through and through. But this doesn't feel right. https://t.co/i6AX6cl0Z1
@bopmafia There are a few past and present first class players playing, but even as a Bay fan this seems like a stitch up to me.
@bopmafia what's the deal behind bringing this guy in?
Ridin' with Bae #pencarrow @ Pencarrow Head Lighthouse https://t.co/tkGfgP7eZn
Al-Dawwwwwwg! #oldmate @ Munchen https://t.co/hbOUB9q37v
Baroness Rachael Heyhoe-Flint. Not just a great cricketer. Just great full stop https://t.co/5GqcaGt6Io @ajarrodkimber
I was so disappointed when I found out this wasn't Dwayne Johnson. https://t.co/sUxIfnSiOu
NZ v South Africa, March 24 2015, last over of NZ's innings. The greatest 2 and half minutes of any cricket game I'… https://t.co/vs0DJGJoD5
@_hehir_ @AnnaGConnell We would. Or as the covenant is otherwise might by known, the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo.
Has anyone ever seen Spock and @JohnJCampbell in the same room? https://t.co/372xVynG6e
One of more bizarre names for a sports team. https://t.co/cPbs6nmK4s
@DennisCricket_ would love to get an audio file of this if you have it.
Slave labour in Wellington graphic design. https://t.co/dq1RkQddC9
@remmarkably name and shame.
@meganjwhelan https://t.co/jOyyeVg2XM Although @phil_cook disagrees with the definition of "craft" https://t.co/CUaXDlHhXr
Happy Invasion Day, @IamNotJonahHill
I want a cat who sits on my shoulders.
@reedfleming @campaignforaid why would you want to?
@scarfacelaws this picture could be a dark metaphor for life generally. Brief moments of sunshine with the constant threat of impending doom
I have become one of those people that angrily wades into Facebook debates about sports. How are the mighty fallen.
"The selectors will need to get the batting order right, and strike a balance between pace and spin" Insightful analysis there, Chappelli.
Is there anything more Kiwi than "this summer weather sucks" news article?
Summer in the #newtownmassive https://t.co/PanixzjUIS
In a nutshell, this tells you all that is wrong with my beloved game. https://t.co/CPYE5VRT3O
@jgmccl amen, my fellow pastry covered sausage fiend.
My girlfriend and I are having an argument about whether sausage rolls are a breakfast food.
@_hehir_ I would argue that, no matter what you do or say, no one deserves some of the vitriol I've heard dished out on occasion.
@blaiserize I mean, I love the atmosphere of a packed stadium. But you pack NZers in one spot in the sun for 6+ hours with smuggled booze...
@blaiserize A downside of the World Cup was being stuck next to groups of fair weather fans getting progressively drunker and more obscene.
I completely agree. Don't give me the "but they do it as well" BS. This is our backyard, and it's unacceptable. https://t.co/WB8cNCc0hp
Someone entered a cake made to look like G-Palm and Dr Butler's constitutional treatise in the RMcV bake-off. Safe to say it was fairly dry.
@hamiltonesquire I thought you'd ditched the designer stubble! Would have been a Gibson Sheat approved travesty.
One to watch for the class action crowd cc @williamfindlay https://t.co/iu89bX4yv6
An absolute disgrace. On every level. https://t.co/PxbxHgV1cz
@hamiltonesquire either you've got a Wellington doppelgänger or you're in my hood today?
Confession: I hate audio/video content on news websites for anything other than sports highlights. No written transcript? I'm not listening.
@hamiltonesquire how would Henry Nicholls be feeling right now?
@hamiltonesquire still haven't got your own office yet, WJ?
Waking up to dog-related snap videos is the best way to wake up. Thanks, @annacantdecide.
What every closet Trekkie thinks when they hear the word "Females" #treklife https://t.co/4gGWM7MqGU
@Sportsfreakconz a chance to try Santner higher with an eye on the SA series. Can't escape the feeling CdG is playing his last test.
@pedrowilliams73 I feel completely the opposite about Ian Smith at least. For mine, our best voice on the team.
@Sportsfreakconz Is he a NZ commentator? I'm happy to disown him.
@Sportsfreakconz "what a shot that is" on repeat, over after over.
@Sportsfreakconz I'm very happy McMillan found another gig.
@Sportsfreakconz maybe he'll improve with time. Simon Doull and Craig Cumming have I guess.
@Sportsfreakconz ha. Well, him then. Nathan McCullum and Kyle Mills the worst of the current bunch.
@Sportsfreakconz was he Australian?
@Sportsfreakconz he was woeful. I have memories of Mystery being bad as well. And whoever that American guy we had in a while ago for Max.
I have TV in mind, but happy to hear submissions for radio as well.
@Sportsfreakconz I had TV in mind. But happy to hear suggestions for either.
Here's a question. Who is, or has been, NZ's worst cricket commentator? #NZvBAN
@scarfacelaws unfollow.
@secondzeit @FoxNews @realDonaldTrump I think you'll find it was always burning since the world's been turning.
@CreetureNZ @simonpnz yeah, Simon. Those aren't the emojis you're looking for.
@CreetureNZ @simonpnz 'twas all the tee, unfortunately. It's solid gold.
@CreetureNZ @simonpnz was that you?! Because yes, you are definitely correct.
@patrick478 @JayHarvie @Garage_Project oh dear.
I love this Town. https://t.co/HohzT8SHI5
@JayHarvie @patrick478 @Garage_Project how can we ensure that future references to this magical drop don't involve that hashtag?
@simonpnz practice makes perfect, Simon. You don't ride the pine unless you're ready to get in the game.
Took my ex girlfriend to a Star Wars movie shortly before we broke up. You could say I was searching for love in Alderaan places.
@rajrnaidu I completely agree. I guess I'm too much of your "Everyman craft beer lover" for the more niche venues.
@rajrnaidu ultimately, it's just one man's opinion.
@rajrnaidu decor, location, vibe, staff interaction. Maybe I've just had a couple of bad experiences.
@rajrnaidu fair play. I'd be interested in seeing the criteria. And I am biased by my love of @LBQWelly.
